name: 尤信程
objective: This course covers a broad classes of machine learning algorithms to be able to conduct research in this field after completing this course. The emphasis of this course is not in the theoretical development (math), but in the understanding level. Therefore, many examples will be given in the lecture to show how to apply the equations to real problems. The detailed contents are given in the course progress field.
schedule:
Week 1: Class announcement and introduction to machine learning (CH 1)
Week 2: Holiday
Week 3: Basics of spervised learning (Example: K NN), VC dimension, and regression (CH 2). Baysian decision theory (CH 3) and Naive Bayes classifiers (CH 5) 
Week 4: ML and MAP estimation; Bias vs variance dilemma (CH 4). Sample mean mean and sample covariance (CH 5). Dimension reduction techniques: PCA, FA (CH 6)
Week 5: Dimension reduction techniques: LDA and ICA. Clustering algorithm: k-mean (CH 7)
Week 6: Unsupervised neural networks (CH 12): Competitive learning, SOFM, and ART. Decision trees: ID3, C4.5, and random forest (CH 8)
Week 7: Holiday
Week 8: Decision trees (continued). Mixer model: GMM and EM algorithm (CH 7)
Week 9: Genetic algorithms. Basics of optiminization.
Week 10: MT
Week 11: MT sol. Gradient search and linear discrimination (CH 10)
Week 12: Feedforward neural networks with examples: radical basis networks and multi-layer perceptrons. Back propagation and regularization methods (CH 11)
Week 13: Deep learning and convolutional neural networks
Week 14: More on deep neural networks: Autoencoder, LSTM, and others 
Week 15: SVM (CH 13) and HMM (CH 15)
Week 16: Combining multiple classifiers (CH 17)
Week 17: Design and analysis of experiments (CH 19) & Reinforcement learning (CH 18)
Week 18: Final exam
materials: Reference text book: Introduction to machine learning. E. Alpaydin. 2nd ed or 3rd ed. Note: textbook is only used to follow the presentation order. Much of the detailed lecture materials are NOT covered in the textbook.
